meanings.definition: A group of confidential, often scheming advisers; a clique.
meanings.sent1: The camarilla of friends always whispered secrets to each other.
meanings.sent2: The camarilla of politicians met in secret to discuss their plans.
meanings.sent3: The camarilla of cats plotted to steal the treats from the pantry.
meanings.sent4: The camarilla of shadows seemed to dance in the dimly lit room.
meanings.sent5: The camarilla of students huddled together to share exam answers.

meanings.definition: A secret, often sinister group or faction.
meanings.sent1: The mysterious camarilla gathered in the abandoned building.
meanings.sent2: The criminal camarilla operated in the shadows of the city.
meanings.sent3: The spooky camarilla of ghosts haunted the old mansion.
meanings.sent4: The hidden camarilla controlled the underground market with an iron fist.
meanings.sent5: The eerie camarilla whispered dark secrets in the dead of night.
